text: Idolatry is Adultery
The righteous \add one\add* perishes, and there is no one who takes\f + \fr 57:1 \ft Or “sets” \f* \add it\add* to heart.

for the righteous is gathered from the presence of wickedness.
he enters \add into\add* peace;

“But\f + \fr 57:3 \ft Or “And” \f* you, come near here, you children of a soothsayer,
offspring \add of\add* an adulterer and she \add who\add* commits fornication.
At whom do you make fun?

\add Are\add* you not children of transgression,
offspring of deception,
who burn with lust among the oaks,
under every leafy tree,
who slaughter children in the valleys,
under the clefts of the rocks?
Your portion \add is\add* among \add the\add* smooth \add stones\add* of \add the\add* valley;
they, they \add are\add* your lot;

Shall I relent concerning these \add things\add*?
You have set your bed upon a high and lofty mountain;
indeed, you went up there to slaughter sacrifice.
And you have set your symbol behind the door and the doorpost;
for you depart\f + \fr 57:8 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “uncover,” which makes no sense in context, but with different vowels it would be “depart” \f* from me, and you go up;

And you climbed down to the king with oil,
and you made your perfumes numerous,
and you sent your envoys ⸤far away⸥,\f + \fr 57:9 \ft Literally “to from far” \f*
and you ⸤sent down deep⸥\f + \fr 57:9 \ft Literally “humiliated” \f* to Sheol.
You grow weary by the greatness of your way,
\add but\add* you did not say, ‘Despairing!’

And of whom were you afraid and feared, that you deceived
and did not remember me?
Did you not place \add it\add* on your heart?
\add Have\add* I not been silent, even from long ago,
and \add so\add* you do not fear me?
I myself will declare your righteousness and your works,
but\f + \fr 57:12 \ft Or “and” \f* they will not benefit you.

Peace for the Contrite
And one shall say, “Build up, build up! Clear \add the\add* way!
Remove \add the\add* obstacles\f + \fr 57:14 \ft Hebrew “obstacle” \f* from the way of my people!”
For thus says \add the\add* high and lofty one who resides forever, and \add whose\add* name \add is\add* holy:
“I reside \add in\add* a high and holy place,
and with \add the\add* ⸤contrite⸥\f + \fr 57:15 \ft Literally “crushed” \f* and humble of spirit,
to revive \add the\add* spirit of \add the\add* humble,
and to revive \add the\add* heart of \add the\add* ⸤contrite⸥.\f + \fr 57:15 \ft Literally “crushed” \f*
For I will not attack forever,
and I will not be angry forever,
for \add the\add* spirit will grow faint before me,
and \add the\add* breaths \add that\add* I myself I have made.
I was angry because of his sin of gain, and I struck him;
I hid and I was angry, but\f + \fr 57:17 \ft Or “and” \f* he walked apostate, in the ways\f + \fr 57:17 \ft Hebrew “way” \f* of his heart.
I have seen his ways, but\f + \fr 57:18 \ft Or “and” \f* I will heal him;
and I will lead him and give him and his mourners comfort as a recompense,
creating fruit of lips.
Peace, peace to the far and near,” says Yahweh, “and I will heal him.
But\f + \fr 57:20 \ft Or “And” \f* the wicked \add are\add* like the churning sea,
that is not able to keep quiet,
and its waters toss up mire and mud.
There is no peace,” says my God, “for the wicked.”
